org_similarity_summary.insight_similar_orgs: Azelio, Invinity Energy Systems Plc, and Moixa Technology operate in the renewable energy sector. Azelio specializes in Stirling engine-based renewable energy systems, while Invinity Energy Systems Plc has developed a method for storing electrical energy in liquid form. Moixa Technology focuses on integrated hardware and GridShare software for renewable energy storage, optimization, and aggregation.

research_insight_text_link.research_insight_description: Azelio is focused on enhancing Stirling engine technology and thermal energy storage systems. Their developments include an alpha type Stirling engine with an expansion cylinder, compression cylinder, regenerator, cooler, heater, and a gas channel for fluid communication. They are also innovating in thermal energy storage, with a transport safe device using phase change materials and a container with a protective coating. Additionally, they are working on systems and methods for controlling the power output of Stirling engines. These advancements aim to improve the efficiency and safety of renewable energy systems.

overview_description.description: Cleanergy becomes Azelio – with a solution to one of the world’s biggest problems.One of the greatest challenges facing humankind today is how to utilize energy from the sun to distribute clean electricity even during the dark hours of the day. They are now on the verge of revealing a ground-breaking solution for highly sustainable, cost-efficient and long-term energy storage.
